text: here's what you see in photos and here's
what you see in real life once upon a
time some 30 years ago Thailand had very
few tourists it was clean authentic and
untouched kind of like how Bhutan is
today but now Bangkok is the world's
most visited city and Thailand attracts
more than 35 million outsiders every
year what's up guys we are not heading
into the Grand Palace of Bangkok the
most touristy site here in Thailand
while mass tourism may have its benefits
like pumping a hundred billion dollars
annually into Thailand's economy there
are five major downfalls that have come
as a result high prices sketchy scams
ruin nature animal cruelty and
prostitution let's dig a little deeper
one expensive prices aside from
Singapore I find Thailand to be the most
expensive country in Southeast Asia
since my first visit here five years ago
I've noticed prices rising and rising
especially near beaches or in big cities
while street food and taxis remain cheap
things like dining at restaurants and
staying at a decent hotel are getting
out of control too sketchy scams as a
tourist it's hard to walk around Bangkok
for an evening and not be a target or a
victim of a scam the most common are the
tuk-tuk scam and the ping-pong show scam
both will invite you inside for a very
cheap price like a hundred baht this is
a ping-pong show how much
and then you'll be hit hard with a
bigger payment that you're forced to pay
three ruin nature Thailand's natural
beauty is quickly being destroyed by all
the pollution like plastic in Bangkok
alone more than 600,000 plastic bags are
used every day dozens of Thailand's have
transformed into party playgrounds for
young adults and they are covered in
trash for animal cruelty Thailand is
notorious for treating animals poorly at
elephant sanctuaries and tiger kingdoms
for the enjoyment of tourists a few
years ago one famous tiger temple was
raided and taken down after proof of
drugged-up Tigers posing for photos five
prostitution mass tourism has led to
mass prostitution Bangkok has three
red-light districts SOI cowboy Nana and
pop phone just walk around and see girls
dancing in doorways and polling you
inside for a special evening and then
there's freelancers who will try to get
your attention on street corners I
realize that this video seemed negative
about Thailand but I want to highlight
the extreme impacts that mass tourism
can bring not only to this country but
to many others around the world the
situation just happens to be the most
severe in Thailand
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
